intro: Laserpitium peucedanoides f. coloratum, commonly known as the purple carrot. This variant is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its striking purple or violet-colored roots. The plant is typically cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant root coloration. It shares a close relationship with the common carrot, differing mainly in its pigmentation and flowering habits. The foliage is finely divided, resembling that of other umbelliferous plants, and it produces small, white flowers in umbels.
